tn.ref: Do not fear; do not be discouraged
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing. Yahweh combines them to emphasize that there is no reason to be afraid. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: I have given into your hand the king of Ai ... and his land
tn.text: Giving them into Israel's hand represents giving Israel victory and control over them. AT: "I have given you victory over the king of Ai and his people, and I have given you control over his city and his land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

God speaks of what he promises to do as though he had already done it, because he will certainly do it. AT: "I will certainly give" or "I am giving" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pastforfuture]])
The word "her" refers to the city of Ai. Cities were often spoken of as if they were women. AT: "its king" or "their king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
"the army of Israel"
"30,000 men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
Joshua continues to explain the battle plan to his soldiers.

tn.ref: will give it into your hand
tn.text: Here "hand" symbolizes the control and power the people have over their enemies. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Joshua finishes explaining the battle plan to his soldiers.
This phrase refers to Joshua sending the thirty thousand men who had been selected to ambush Ai to where they would set the ambush.
"where they would hide until it was time to attack"

"5,000 men." This group seems to be a portion of the "thirty thousand men" ([[:en:bible:notes:jos:08:08|8:9]]). This smaller group remained in the ambush while the other 25,000 men attacked the city. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
The Israelites prepare to fight the people of Ai.
This refers to the largest group of fighting men, those not in the ambush group.
those who were "set in ambush on the west side of the city" (See: [[:en:bible:notes:jos:08:10|8:12]])

tn.ref: let themselves be defeated before them
tn.text: "let themselves be defeated before the people of Ai." The phrase "before them" represents what the people of Ai would see and think. AT: "let the people of Ai think that the Israelites were defeated" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: let themselves be defeated before them
tn.text: The phrase "be defeated" can be stated in active form. AT: "let the people of Ai think that they had defeated the Israelites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: before them ... they went after ... they were drawn away
tn.text: The words "them" and "they" here refer to the army of Ai.
The words "they" and "them" here refer to the army of Isreal.

tn.ref: All the people who were in the city were called together
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The city leaders called all the people in the city together" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: All the people who were in the city
tn.text: The writer speaks in a general way about all the people, but it was all the people who could fight. AT: "all the people in the city who could help chase the army of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
"left the city gates open"

tn.ref: I will give Ai into your hand
tn.text: Giving Ai into Israel's hand represents giving Israel victory and control over Ai. AT: "I will give you victory over Ai" or "I will cause you to capture Ai"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: when Israel had finished killing all the inhabitants ... when all of them ... had fallen by the edge of the sword
tn.text: The writer uses both of these sentences, which mean almost the same thing, to strongly say that the Israelites had obeyed God's command to kill everyone in Ai. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: had fallen by the edge of the sword
tn.text: Here falling represents dying, and the edge of the sword represents either battle or the army of Israel. AT: "had died in battle" or "had died when the army of Israel attacked them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"12,000" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
It is a place where people once lived, but now, no one lives there.
"today" or "even now"
a mountain in Canaan (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: There was not one word from all that Moses commanded that Joshua did not read
tn.text: This can be expressed positively. AT: "Joshua read every word of all that Moses commanded" or "Joshua read the entire law of Moses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
This refers to the nation of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
